intro: Motleyothamnus corymbosus, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense clusters of yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and sagebrush habitats. Its foliage consists of narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, aiding in water conservation. Motleyothamnus corymbosus is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
